Marketing: You may struggle to promote your book and reach your target audience. This can be particularly challenging if you don't have a large platform or network to rely on.
Editing: You may struggle to find a good editor to proofread and edit your book. Alternatively, you may struggle to edit your book yourself, which can lead to errors or inconsistencies.
Time Management: Writing a book can be a time-consuming process, and you may struggle to balance this with other responsibilities.
Finding Inspiration: You may struggle to come up with plotlines and characters that are unique and engaging.
Self-Doubt: You may experience self-doubt while writing, which can be detrimental to your productivity and motivation.
